thread.title: Queen Creek gets big win over Westview
thread.title_full: Queen Creek gets big win over Westview

title: Queen Creek gets big win over Westview
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Queen Creek gets big win over Westview A lights-out defense was the difference-maker Friday Night for the Queen Creek football team as the Bulldogs captured a 34-13 win at home over the Avondale Westview Knights and their high-powered offense. Post to Facebook Queen Creek gets big win over Westview A lights-out defense was the difference-maker Friday Night for the Queen Creek football team as the Bulldogs captured a 34-13 win at home over the Avondale Westview Knights and their high-powered offense.   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1S20Whc   Join the Conversation To   Queen Creek gets big win over Westview Kelsey Perry, Special to 12 Sports 12:27 a.m. MST October 24, 2015 Westview vs Queen Creek KPNX Queen Creek beats Westview CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A lights-out defense was the difference-maker Friday Night for the Queen Creek football team as the Bulldogs captured a 34-13 win at home over the Avondale Westview Knights and their high-powered offense. 
"It was kind of a playoff atmosphere and they answered the bell tonight,"Queen Creek coach Travis Schureman said. 
The Bulldogs defense held Westview scoreless for the first half and the offense answered a late charge by tacking two fourth-quarter touchdowns on the board in the victory. 
Quarterback Kaleb Honea said the strong finish is a confidence-builder of his team at this point in the season. 
"After Poston Butte (next week) we'll be going into playoffs so we've got go in with a lot of momentum so hopefully we can take it all the way to state,"he said. 
Coming into Friday's contest against Queen Creek, Westview was averaging 42.3 points a game led by a run-heavy offense that was totaling 390.6 yards on the ground each week. 
Schureman said his team felt it had something to prove. 
"We kind of took it personal a little bit that people said that they were going to run it down our throats because we like to take a physical type of football,"Schureman said. "I was happy with the way we came out and played tonight." 
Both offenses came out a little slow, but the Bulldogs defense forced back-to-back turnovers in the second quarter and the offense turned each into a touchdown. Queen Creek led 19-0 at halftime. 
"It was a great team effort on defense,"Schureman said. "It's 11 guys just getting to the ball and hitting the ball carrier and most people don't like that. 
Westview's offense got going in the third quarter, scoring on a 10-yard run by Stacy Campbell and then on a 46-yard run by Rodney Knox to pull within six points but Queen Creek responded in the fourth quarter, with a one-yard run by Honea and a nine-yard touchdown pass from Honea to Jordan Ackert which put the game out of reach for the Knights. 
Queen Creek and Westview both sit 7-2 heading into the final game of the season. The teams are in a tight race in Division II that also includes the likes of Mesa Skyline, Gilbert Williams Field and Scottsdale Saguaro. 
Honae said the Bulldogs confidence-level is high. 
"I feel we have a great chance no matter who matter who we play,"he said. Read or Share this story: http://12ne.ws/1S20Whc TOP VIDEOS
